services.label: Memorial & Gravesite Care
services.summary: Provide dignified, respectful maintenance of gravesites and memorials for families unable to visit regularly. Clean headstones, place flowers, remove debris, and send photo updates with compassionate service.
services.expanded:
How It Works: Offer gravesite maintenance services for families living far from loved ones' burial sites or unable to visit due to mobility, health, or time constraints. Services include cleaning headstones, removing debris, placing fresh or artificial flowers, trimming grass around markers, and seasonal decorations. Take before/after photos to send families. Offer one-time services (holidays, anniversaries) or recurring monthly/seasonal packages. Handle requests with utmost sensitivity and professionalism.

Tools & Startup Gear: Cleaning supplies: soft-bristle brushes, pH-neutral stone cleaner (never harsh chemicals), microfiber cloths, spray bottles, buckets, and protective gloves. Gardening tools: hand pruners, small rake, trash bags, and weed remover. Flowers and decorations: artificial or fresh arrangements, seasonal wreaths, small flags (veteran graves). Camera or smartphone for documentation. Transportation to access various cemeteries. Weatherproof storage container for supplies kept in vehicle.

Certifications & Requirements: Background check required—families are trusting you with sacred memorial care. No formal certifications needed, though understanding cemetery etiquette and headstone preservation crucial. Business license may be required. Liability insurance recommended. Obtain cemetery permission before providing services—some cemeteries have strict vendor policies or maintenance restrictions. Respect cemetery hours and rules (no loud noise, stay on pathways, follow decoration guidelines). Never remove items placed by families without explicit permission.

Safety & Best Practices: Treat every gravesite with dignity and reverence—this is someone's beloved family member. Photograph headstone before cleaning to document condition. Use only cemetery-approved cleaning methods—harsh chemicals damage stone permanently. Never use pressure washers or abrasive materials on old or fragile markers. Work quietly and respectfully—be mindful of grieving visitors. Dispose of debris properly in designated cemetery bins. Confirm flower preferences (fresh vs. artificial, colors, types) before purchasing. Send updates to families promptly with compassionate messages. Respect privacy—never share gravesite photos publicly without family permission. Mark calendar for significant dates (birthdays, death anniversaries) to offer proactive service.

Pricing Model: Basic cleaning visit: $30–$75 per gravesite. Cleaning + flower placement: $50–$125. Seasonal decoration package: $75–$150 (includes themed decor for holidays). Monthly maintenance subscription: $60–$150/month for regular upkeep. Special occasion services (birthdays, anniversaries): $40–$100. Travel fees for cemeteries over 15 miles: $10–$30. Multi-plot family discounts: 15–20% off when caring for multiple adjacent sites. Offer compassionate pricing for families experiencing financial hardship.

Upsell & Business Growth: Expand to monument restoration or repair referrals (partner with specialists). Offer research services tracing family genealogy or military service. Provide video messages showing care process for distant families. Create memorial anniversary reminder service. Partner with funeral homes, assisted living facilities, or veteran organizations for referrals. Offer estate services organizing and cleaning family plots. Coordinate memorial services for families unable to attend in person. Market through cemetery offices, grief support groups, and senior living communities.

Get Gigified Badge: Earn the Memorial Guardian badge after providing respectful care to 100 gravesites with 100% family satisfaction and demonstrated commitment to dignity, compassion, and preservation. This badge honors your sacred work helping families maintain connections with departed loved ones across distance and time.

services.label: Personal Videographer (Events & Special Moments)
services.summary: Capture life's precious moments through professional video—weddings, birthdays, graduations, family reunions, or milestone events. Create cinematic keepsakes families treasure for generations.
services.expanded:
How It Works: Film special events or personal milestones for clients wanting professional video memories. Pre-event consultation to understand shot list, key moments, and style preferences (cinematic, documentary, highlight reel). Arrive early to scout locations and test equipment. Capture ceremony, speeches, candid moments, and reactions. Edit footage into polished final product with music, transitions, and color correction. Deliver via digital download, USB drive, or streaming link. Offer raw footage options for clients wanting full coverage.

Tools & Startup Gear: Essential: quality camera (DSLR, mirrorless, or cinema camera capable of 4K video), multiple batteries, memory cards (high capacity and speed), tripod, gimbal or stabilizer for smooth motion shots, external microphone (lavalier or shotgun for clear audio), and LED lighting panels for low-light situations. Editing setup: computer with sufficient processing power, editing software (Adobe Premiere Pro, Final Cut Pro, DaVinci Resolve), backup external hard drives. Optional: drone for aerial shots (requires FAA Part 107 license), additional lenses (wide-angle, telephoto).

Certifications & Requirements: Background check for private events and homes. No mandatory certifications for ground videography. FAA Part 107 Remote Pilot Certificate required for commercial drone operations. Business license and liability insurance essential—equipment is expensive and event mishaps happen. Understand media release forms and privacy rights—never publish client footage publicly without written permission. Copyright awareness: use royalty-free or licensed music in final edits (avoid copyrighted songs without proper licensing). Backup insurance for equipment (theft, damage) highly recommended.

Safety & Best Practices: Always bring backup equipment (cameras, batteries, memory cards)—never rely on single devices for once-in-a-lifetime events. Format memory cards before event and test all equipment 24 hours prior. Arrive 30–60 minutes early to set up and troubleshoot. Stay unobtrusive during intimate moments (vows, toasts, emotional scenes). Communicate with event coordinator or photographer to avoid blocking shots. Back up footage immediately after event—multiple copies on separate drives. Use media release forms for all clients specifying usage rights and delivery timeline. Provide clear contracts defining deliverables, editing timelines (typical 4–8 weeks), and revision policies (usually 1–2 rounds included). Never delete original footage until client confirms satisfaction.

Pricing Model: Hourly rate: $75–$200/hour for filming only (2-hour minimum). Half-day packages (4–6 hours filming + basic edit): $500–$1,500. Full-day wedding packages (8+ hours filming + cinematic edit): $1,500–$5,000+. Simple highlight reel (3–5 minutes): $300–$800. Full ceremony edit (30–60 minutes): $800–$2,000. Add-ons: drone footage +$200–$500, raw footage delivery +$100–$300, rush editing (under 2 weeks) +$200–$500, additional edited copies +$50 each. Require 25–50% deposit to secure date.

Upsell & Business Growth: Specialize in event types: weddings, quinceañeras, bar/bat mitzvahs, corporate events, or real estate tours. Offer photography + videography packages. Create anniversary video services (compile old photos/videos into tributes). Provide legacy interview services for elderly family members. Partner with event planners, wedding venues, or photography studios. Teach videography workshops or offer editing services for DIY filmers. Create subscription model for businesses (monthly promotional videos, social media content). Build YouTube channel with sample work and tips to attract organic clients.

Get Gigified Badge: Earn the Memory Keeper badge after filming and editing 30 events with 95% client satisfaction and demonstrated technical proficiency (stabilization, audio quality, color grading). This badge recognizes your ability to capture fleeting moments and transform them into timeless treasures that families cherish forever.

services.label: Pop-Up Party Host
services.summary: Transform any space into an instant celebration with portable party setups. Bring themes to life with decorations, activities, and hosting energy for birthdays, corporate events, or spontaneous gatherings.
services.expanded:
How It Works: Provide turnkey pop-up party experiences at client locations (homes, offices, parks, or event spaces). Arrive with themed decorations, activities, games, and hosting services. Set up quickly, facilitate entertainment or activities, and clean up afterward. Offer pre-designed themes (unicorn birthday, retro game night, tropical luau, movie premiere) or custom concepts. Perfect for clients wanting professional parties without permanent decoration investments or planning stress.

Tools & Startup Gear: Reusable decor library: tablecloths, banners, centerpieces, balloons, backdrop stands, string lights, and themed props organized by collection (princesses, superheroes, elegant adult, etc.). Activity supplies: board games, craft materials, photo booth props, music playlist library, portable speaker. Setup tools: extension cords, tape, command hooks, scissors, zip ties. Transportation: vehicle or trailer for hauling party gear. Storage space for maintaining organized theme collections. Folding tables and chairs optional depending on service model.

Certifications & Requirements: Background check for entering homes and workplaces. No formal certifications needed—creativity and energy are key qualifications. Event planning or hospitality experience helpful. Business license required. Liability insurance essential in case of accidents during events (trips, falls, equipment damage). Understand venue regulations if working in public spaces (permits for parks, noise restrictions). Food handler certification if providing any food items. Never promise activities beyond your liability coverage (bouncy houses, water slides require specialized insurance).

Safety & Best Practices: Inspect venue beforehand to plan setup and identify safety concerns. Secure all decorations properly—nothing should fall or create trip hazards. Supervise activities appropriate for age group and setting. Bring first-aid kit to all events. Confirm power outlet availability for equipment needing electricity. Use flame-retardant decorations, especially near candles or heat sources. Pack down and organize reusable items immediately after event for longevity. Document setups with photos for portfolio and marketing. Respect venue cleanliness—leave spaces better than you found them. Get written approval on theme and activity plan before event day.

Pricing Model: Basic pop-up setup (2 hours setup + hosting + cleanup): $200–$500 depending on theme complexity and guest count. Premium themes with interactive activities: $500–$1,200. Add-ons: additional hour of hosting +$75–$150, photo booth rental +$100–$250, custom backdrop or signage +$50–$150, party favors or goodie bags +$5–$15 per guest. Corporate event packages: $800–$3,000 for team-building activities and branded setups. Travel fees for venues over 20 miles. Require 50% deposit at booking.

Upsell & Business Growth: Develop signature theme packages marketed through social media showcasing stunning setups. Offer DIY rental option (decor rental without hosting service) at 40% of full-service price. Partner with venues (community centers, event spaces) for package deals. Create corporate team-building experiences (game show themes, escape room setups). Expand to holiday decoration services (Halloween, Christmas home decorating). Teach party planning or DIY decoration workshops. Build subscription model for companies hosting monthly employee celebrations. Collaborate with caterers, photographers, or entertainers for full-service event packages.

Get Gigified Badge: Earn the Instant Celebration Creator badge after hosting 50 pop-up parties with 90% client satisfaction and demonstrated ability to transform ordinary spaces into extraordinary experiences efficiently. This badge celebrates your talent for bringing joy, energy, and magical moments wherever you go.

services.label: Proposal or Surprise Planner
services.summary: Orchestrate unforgettable marriage proposals and life-changing surprise moments. Coordinate every detail from secret planning to flawless execution, creating stories couples share for a lifetime.
services.expanded:
How It Works: Work confidentially with proposer to plan surprise engagement or other significant life surprises (pregnancy announcements, homecoming reveals, adoption celebrations). Scout locations, coordinate timing, arrange decorations, hire photographer/videographer, manage logistics, and ensure everything unfolds perfectly. Stay hidden or nearby during execution to troubleshoot last-minute issues. Capture or coordinate documentation of the moment. Celebrate successful surprise with clients afterward. Requires discretion, attention to detail, and stress management under pressure.

Tools & Startup Gear: Planning essentials: detailed timeline templates, vendor contact list (photographers, florists, musicians), location scouting checklist, and backup plans for weather/complications. Day-of kit: two-way radios or headsets for coordinating helpers, emergency supplies (tape, scissors, phone charger), weather protection (umbrellas, tarps), and timeline printouts for all participants. Decoration supplies based on theme (candles, flowers, signs, lighting). Professional attire for blending into public settings discreetly. Transportation for setup and coordination.

Certifications & Requirements: Background check essential—clients are trusting you with life's most intimate moments. No formal certifications needed, though event planning experience highly valuable. Business license required. Liability insurance critical in case accidents or mishaps occur during surprise. Understand location permits (public parks, restaurants, landmarks may require permission or fees). Build strong network of trusted vendors who can execute on short notice. Maintain strict confidentiality—one slip ruins everything. Never share surprise details on social media before event, even vaguely.

Safety & Best Practices: Conduct thorough location scouting in advance—test sight lines, lighting, accessibility, and backup shelter. Confirm all vendor timing 48 hours before and day-of morning. Have contingency plans for weather, location closures, or surprise recipient schedule changes. Coordinate with venue staff or security when working in semi-private spaces (restaurants, hotels). Brief all helpers on their roles and timing—practice if possible. Stay in communication via phone or radio during execution. Never pressure surprised person to respond certain way—emotions vary. Respect if they need private moment before photographs. Ensure proposer has realistic expectations—surprises don't always go exactly as planned. Document all agreements in writing to protect against miscommunication.

Pricing Model: Consultation and basic planning: $200–$500 for location recommendations and timeline creation. Full-service surprise coordination: $800–$3,000+ depending on complexity, vendor coordination, and location logistics. Elaborate productions (flash mobs, large-scale decorations, multiple locations): $3,000–$10,000+. Add-ons: photographer/videographer coordination +$200–$500 (plus vendor costs), custom signage or props +$100–$400, musician or entertainer coordination +$150–$300, post-proposal celebration setup +$300–$800. Require 50% deposit upon booking, remainder 48 hours before event.

Upsell & Business Growth: Expand to other surprise services: gender reveals, milestone birthday surprises, or reunion planning. Offer post-engagement services: save-the-date coordination or full wedding planning. Partner with jewelers for referral programs. Create proposal packages bundled with photography, flowers, and champagne toast. Develop signature location relationships (rooftop venues, scenic overlooks, private estates). Teach proposal planning workshops for DIY proposers. Build portfolio with stunning photography (with permission) to attract high-end clients. Offer destination proposal coordination for travel engagements.

Get Gigified Badge: Earn the Perfect Moment Architect badge after successfully planning and executing 25 surprise proposals or major life events with 98% success rate and zero critical failures. This badge represents your mastery of discretion, timing, and creating magical moments that change lives forever.

services.label: Social Media Moments
services.summary: Create scroll-stopping social media content for individuals and small businesses. Film, edit, and deliver engaging short videos optimized for Instagram, TikTok, and other platforms to boost online presence.
services.expanded:
How It Works: Help clients build social media presence through professional short-form video content. Meet to discuss brand, goals, and content style. Plan shoot concepts (product showcases, behind-the-scenes, tutorials, lifestyle content). Film using smartphone or camera with creative angles, good lighting, and engaging compositions. Edit quickly using mobile apps or desktop software adding music, text overlays, transitions, and effects. Optimize for platform specs (vertical 9:16, captions, hashtags). Deliver ready-to-post content. Offer one-time shoots or monthly content packages.

Tools & Startup Gear: Camera options: high-quality smartphone (iPhone 12+, Samsung S21+) or entry-level mirrorless camera. Essential accessories: phone tripod or gimbal for stabilization, ring light or portable LED panel for flattering lighting, external microphone (lavalier for interviews, shotgun for b-roll), and backdrop or reflector for controlled shoots. Editing: Mobile apps (CapCut, InShot, VN Editor) or desktop software (Adobe Premiere Rush, Final Cut Pro). Props and styling items based on niche. Cloud storage for delivering finished content.

Certifications & Requirements: Background check for entering businesses or homes. No formal certifications required—portfolio demonstrates style and quality. Social media marketing courses helpful for understanding platform algorithms and trends. Business license required. Understand platform content policies (copyright, prohibited content). Use royalty-free music from apps' libraries or licensed music to avoid takedowns. Respect media release forms—never post client content publicly without permission. Understand FTC disclosure requirements if creating sponsored or promotional content (must clearly label ads).

Safety & Best Practices: Get written permission for filming locations, especially businesses or private property. Use media release forms for anyone appearing in content. Stay current with platform trends but maintain brand consistency for clients. Optimize videos for mobile viewing (large text, clear visuals, captions for sound-off viewing). Deliver content with suggested captions, hashtags, and posting times. Set realistic expectations—viral success isn't guaranteed. Provide quick turnaround (24–72 hours ideal for trending content). Back up all raw footage until client confirms satisfaction. Never guarantee follower counts or engagement rates—focus on quality content creation.

Pricing Model: Single video (concept, film, edit): $75–$250 depending on complexity and length. Content packages: 4 videos/month $250–$600, 8 videos/month $450–$1,000, 12 videos/month $600–$1,500. Add-ons: scriptwriting or concept development +$50–$100 per video, on-location shooting (vs. in-studio) +$75–$150, rush delivery (under 24 hours) +$100–$200, usage rights for ads +20–50% fee. Offer startup packages for new businesses: 10-video library for $800–$1,500. Require 50% deposit for new clients.

Upsell & Business Growth: Specialize in industries: restaurants, fitness studios, boutiques, real estate, or personal brands (coaches, influencers). Offer social media management beyond content creation (scheduling, community management, analytics). Teach smartphone videography workshops for DIY businesses. Create content templates or presets for passive income. Partner with marketing agencies or web designers for bundled services. Provide UGC (user-generated content) style videos for brand partnerships. Offer live event coverage for real-time posting. Build your own social media presence showcasing your work to attract clients organically.

Get Gigified Badge: Earn the Viral Content Creator badge after producing 200 social media videos with 90% client satisfaction and demonstrated ability to create engaging, platform-optimized content that drives views and engagement. This badge proves your finger is on the pulse of digital trends and your skill in translating ideas into shareable moments.
